publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

monogr.title: Opiologia: or, A treatise concerning the nature, properties, true preparation and safe vse and administration of opium : For the comfort and ease of all such persons as are inwardly afflicted with any extreame griefe, or languishing paine, especially such as depriue the bod of all naturall rest, and can be cured by no other meanes or medicine whatsoeuer. Dedicated to the illustrious, high and mighty lords, the estates generall of the vnited prouinces in the Netherlands. By Angelus Sala Vincentinus Venitus. And done into English, and something inlarged by Tho. Bretnor M. M
monogr.author: Sala, Angelo

lg.l: AMong those powerfull guifts to man infus'd,
What better is thē knowledge of those plants,
Which for two thousand yeares were only vs'd:
As meate and sustinance to humaine Saints

For neither flesh, nor fish, the Highe •
gra • ts:
Till cataclismed world so weake wa • growne,
That fruit and hearbs could not suffice alone.
And yet we find in basest plants that grew
('Mongst those accompted weeds of witlesse men)
Such strange effects that farre surpasse we know:
The sence and reason of the learned'st pen,
(More is the blindnesse of our nature then▪)
Witnesse the Poppie whereby Greeke and Turke
By planting profit, and do wonders worke.
